Audible.body: Audible was reasonably good while I was using it though some would argue a bit on the pricey side. It’s a good service if you can’t find time to read yourself or just need to relax and listen to a book. If you try and cancel the service, boy are you in for a rough ride. For a start you can’t do this via the mobile app and have to go through their website. When you do eventually find the section and go through with it, there are no guarantees that you won’t continue to be billed. I cancelled and despite my membership saying it’s not active now as well as a confirmation email I was still charged at the end of the following month. Cancelled 21st Feb, membership officially ended on the 3rd of March I believe and then charged again on the 31st. You go through their first call option which is some sort of online call (after fighting disheartened through more roundabouts of help options) and the call just cancels after a few minutes of waiting, repeatedly. Try the toll free number and well guess what, it says it is not currently active!!! Classic scam warning signs but Audible isn’t a scam. I cancelled cause I don’t have a job now but I’m waiting to see whether some of my food money will disappear at the end of this month if I get charged again. Not happy!!

Audible.title: Not Impressed
Audible.body: Downloaded and paid for membership back in February. Cancelled membership on audible.com over the summer but still found they were still charging me monthly after the fact. Called customer support to find out what the charge is for. Ended up finding out audible.ca had been charging me - even though audible.ca came out after I had bought the membership. Issue: audible.com says I am not enrolled in a membership, whereas audible.ca says that I am. I understand that these are two different services but this is one company. I think it’s ridiculous and very misleading that one company related site would say I don’t have a membership, while another company related site says that I do. Customer service did not even offer a refund for the months I cancelled my subscription on audible.com Please work on having some sort of uniformity when it comes to membership information displayed across your websites.

Audible.title: Very difficult to cancel subscription
Audible.body: I subscribed to Audible but found listening to books wasn’t for me.  When I went to cancel, I found it difficult throughout the process.  You can’t cancel from the app or through the mobile site...only the desktop.

Audible.title: there could be major  improvements to this app
Audible.body: The app worked better before, after all these updates the app for IOS is very flaky. Cuts out, freezes, stops, won’t load, a whole mess of things. My rating has gone down for this app since the quality has gone down significantly.

Audible.title: Buggy, expensive, bloated, wont sync with Apple Watch
Audible.body: ...but apart from that, great!Sent a detailed description of my issue to support. They sent me instructions for how to install the app, and a cheerful promise that I would then be able to listen to audiobooks. Deleting and reinstalling, this app now comes with half a dozen excerpts of books, in French for some reason, with no option to delete them. Maybe it’s mad at me because I wouldn’t share my iTunes library with it?When it is “working”, I can search for books but get a message that says “this app can not be used to purchase content” even though I am a subscriber. I have to go to a separate website if I actually want any of the books.

Audible.title: Terrible UX
Audible.body: It should not be this difficult to BUY something from a company. I should be able to make purchases inside the app or at least click a button that would take me directly to an outside URL where I can pay for the item I want. Will delete app after listening to a podcast series only on Audible.

Audible.title: HORRIBLE APP
Audible.body: This is bar far the worst app on iOS. I cannot understand how anyone would rate this five stars. It is the most un-user friendly app I’ve ever been on. Feels like it was made by 5th graders.

Audible.title: Many faults
Audible.body: Where is the free category?  Can’t buy and download directly in the app?  Seriously!?!?  Work it out with Apple!  I’m sure you can find a way.

Audible.title: Hard to cancel
Audible.body: ‘Free trial’ but you need a desktop to even cancel. You cannot cancel through mobile or the app but you can use those to sign up. Don’t fall for it.

Audible.title: User beware
Audible.body: This app deletes all purchased book tokens, regardless of count, if you cancel the service. I had a purportedly odd situation of having my accrued tokens deducted when I opted to pay cash for an audio book. Some audio books will not be worth the monthly book time you get from the subscription. Instead of investigating my complaints I received formulaic responses about browser caches and otherwise. After deciding to cancel, only the did I learn that all the money I spent on book tokens was going to be deleted. Every other service I have ever dealt with at the very least offers some manner of refund for the unused portion of the service. So beware. Audible comes with a very unpleasant lock-in mechanism that will punish you for cancelling.

Audible.title: Ridiculous
Audible.body: One of the worst experiences ever on an App. How do you buy books? You don’t, they sit in your wishlist forever because you can only listen to 5 minute samples.

Audible.title: What an incredible ride!
Audible.body: Started watching Glenn Lundy’s Saturday Morning meets! The end of 2017! A man by the way of John Dawson kept bragging about a store selling  over 800 cars in a small southern town! I thought this has to be bulldodo! But boy was I wrong.    In late January 2018. I set my alarm to get up at 5:30 am to watch a morning podcast! Never had heard one live before. And this man in closet. Was exited that I was watching him. He started telling me good morning, good morning, good morning! I thought the dude was a super human! And over time of getting up early!      My whole world changed.    I was ready to do something different in 2018. Then  I gained our #riseandfamily , hustle and Grind Con in 2018 in October! My income doubled. And the triple after being in the car business since 1981 or 2 cleaning my dad’s service bays and parts department after school and on Saturday. Then running his detail department at Weatherby Auto Sales in 1987. Basically grew up in the business 3rd generation.      But this book by Glenn Lundy The Legacy Titles ! has got me thinking again to venture out on my own. After getting my lifelong dream job as Used Car Manger at Marietta Toyota! Where people had to retire or die before you could get a job there!  Thank you again Mr Glenn Lundy for all you have done for my growth in the car business just a big breath of fresh air! In a very  long time stagnant industry!! Love you Brother!!

Audible.title: Be careful
Audible.body: I was a big Audible user and supporter for years. When the membership terms required a monthly fee, I stayed with. Happy to use the large audio library for members only. The idea of earning a credit a month to use for any premium item also fine. I had accumulated four credits, when I decided to take a break . Now this is the problem, and in reality it is my fault for not reading the fine print. I THOUGHT that I would take a few months off of the membership to use credits that have been building up. Fully planning on rejoining in a few months time. What I did not realize was that once you suspend the membership you lose all of your accumulated credits .. back to zero. If you seek out this information you will find it. I never looked at the whole contract . Kind of silly to pay monthly and then lose all of you credits if you stop temporarily or otherwise.. Without this issue Audible is a five star company, but this nickel and diming was and is unfair, stated or not , fine print or not. So this is a cautionary tale. If you are a member  or plan on becoming one be advised that if you stop your membership you will lose all of you amassed credits. If you are the type of person that uses the credit immediately, then you are fine. Otherwise heed the warning. You will get your credits erased too.

Audible.title: Kudos to the developers
Audible.body: I’m back to loving the app! My original negative review is below. I got a response from Audible developers who instructed me on how to remove the Alexa button. It was actually very simple, but I couldn’t figure out how before, and had even contacted Audible Help (before I wrote the review) but the rep said Alexa couldn’t be removed. So I’m very happy again with this app. And I’d like the Alexa button if it were in a different location in car mode. Here’s my original review:The new Alexa button is annoying, and frankly, a little dangerous. I used to be able to hit the "rewind" and "bookmark" buttons in car mode without looking down at my screen while driving. Now I have to look at the screen to hit those buttons because otherwise I accidentally hit that HUGE Alexa button at the bottom of the screen. (Which interrupts my book.) Super frustrating. Sure, I could use the Alexa button instead, but it takes longer to hit the button and say "rewind 10 seconds" than just hitting the rewind button like I used to be able to easily do. The Alexa button isn't a bad idea, but why couldn't they have put it somewhere else, and not make it so big? This has ruined the app for me. I sure hope they fix this terrible design in future updates. I’ll gladly change my 2 star rating to a 4 or 5 if they do.

Audible.title: Most used app I have aside from gps
Audible.body: Love this app so much. Had it for years and does not disappoint. Thank you for being here, existing and being in my life. Such a great idea and concept. Sorry it took me so long to rate this amazing app! Get it, you won’t regret it, so many wonderful title and books and not over priced!Update: This is still a great app but it needs to be said that the home tab is waaay too much noise visually speaking. Way too many suggestions and advertised books for an app. It’s not a clean look and honestly it’s ugly. The app needs a more sleek minimalist feel for ease of use. I literally get anxiety seeing the homepage with all the extra books recommendations, catalogues and so forth. When I use the app I just want to get to the point not be defaulted to a crazy looking page foot of book images. Please higher someone to update your app comestically. With the IOS update people are discovering less is more with widgets and less apps. Try to use that same concept, I want to see recommendations make it the last tab not the first. Have the first tab be the library and instead of a line chart of books maybe give the option of line display or chart display, just something more sleek please.Update 03 May 2021: The app skips the audio for some reason and when the screen goes dark it stops playing. Please fix this. This is pretty frustrating and my settings don’t have anything that causes this to happen.

Audible.title: Why do they update, only to break the app
Audible.body: Had my new iPhone 15 pro max less then a month. Go to download my catalog of titles only to find out anything over a GB won’t work. It only streams, as I’ve tried twice since the most recent updates. I called and logged the issue with Audible, and told to download in parts. I love the bigger books all in one file. It was fine on my old iPhone 11 Pro Max. I have reflex sympathetic dystrophy, I can no longer hold books or write. So using Audible is so important to me when it comes to the Bible. Use daily and take notes through the app. The app even encourages customers to download all in one file. That’s great, but it doesn’t work anymore for books larger then GB. If anyone like me you have larger libraries, this means can’t even use higher quality downloads on many books. But it’s getting ridiculous the way Audible has gotten lazy. It happens every other year with iOS update and app updates. It either wipes out all of your downloads, or it breaks the app to be able to download. I’ve been at the premium level since 2012, I can’t count the times I’ve bought three extra credits a month. When they had their reading challenges last year, had the amount listened to in a week. I love this app, but I need it to work at the level it has for so many years before. Need this to be addressed and fixed. I can call again and be told sorry, and given extra credits. I don’t want to call anymore if nothing is going to be done to correct the issue.

Audible.title: Just okay
Audible.body: The first part of the book starts out centering on a family…Jill, David and their daughter, Sofia.  Right away, I was annoyed with Jill and sadly, Sophia. Jill is a helicopter mom, her life centers around Sophia and everything else, including her husband, is a distant second. Sophia is a spoiled brat. Jill had a rough upbringing and then a traumatic event happens in their lives which leads to Jill being unattached and distant, as well as, having a hard time relating to many people.The second part of the book is where it picks up. Someone takes Sophia. We also get more into another character, Bea, who has a lot to do with, well everything. I won’t divulge because it would reveal too much. We are also given several snippets of a third character, via her journal. That is the part of this book that I really enjoyed.I pretty much knew right away who all the players were before the author came right out with it.  What I didn’t like about this story was all the loose ends left open. There were SO MANY. I feel like the author didn’t give Jill and David their due redemption.I will say this book really was a page turner and I listened to it even when I wasn’t commuting, which is rare.  Aside from the way RD finished this book, it was a good story and the narration was A+. Would I listen to it again…probably not.

Audible.title: A Genius business with enjoyable features
Audible.body: This has been a wonderful way to save time and achieve the same result. I have being able to perform labor tasks or even play video games which take up a different response sector from my ability to focus, perform, absorb and respond. While I can divide my attention, this nifty app allows me to focus on both my physical labor and the text/ideas being shared here with the same intensity and similar results. The narrators so far have been great, their tempo, punctuation and emphasis has been on point. The variety of works from which to chose is broad and so far I have found most if not all of the books I wanted to read/listen to. Also, the fact that Audible provides free credits every so often is remarkable( imagine not only how much money is saved but also time to travel and shop for these. Not to mention what if they are difficult to find provided their less then popular demand). The features to control the speed of the narration, also the ability to play on the background for if in the midst of listening one should attend a communication from a friend or family and not want to disturb the suspense built on the best part of the book.   Also, I am sure there are other features I have not explored. So this is it for this review being. Thank you 🙏

Audible.title: I almost never read anything with a perfect score, but Audible deserves a five, nothing less.
Audible.body: This is simply a tremendous app. It is thoroughly and I mean completely accessible for use by blind people and others with various disabilities. This is a wonderful ethic that Audible has that very few other companies do. I have over 1000 books in my library, and I’ve been with Audible using its application since about the year 2000. I joined Audible not expecting much… But they have proof to be a company that is responsive and one that cares very much about their users.The Audible app has become indispensable to me, and I can only say that about one or two other apps, among many on my phone. It simply works, and works well. My favorite feature is that it organizes series in their chronologically released order. This means that you can see immediately in your library if you’ve missed one in a long series of books that you enjoy, and can usually immediately purchase it right through the app.Audible, I am retired now, but I look forward to many years of listening pleasure, and it’s all possible because you’ve made such a wonderfully accessible and useful application. Thank you, and please keep up the good work.John Esak.

Audible.title: Some issues but overall worth the price
Audible.body: I love audible, it’s easily my favorite app and really the only reason I use my phone for anything other than communication. The price is more than reasonable, for $15 you get access to a lot of really solid books, plus a credit to use on any book you want, no matter the price. Depending on their age and popularity, some books can be upwards of $30 by themselves, so that’s a pretty sweet deal. Credits carry over and, as long as you keep your membership, they will not expire (if you cancel, be sure to use any left over credits before you do). My only advice is to check the book’s price before you use a credit on it. As I said before, a credit is good for any price book, but that also goes for inexpensive books. They don’t make it easy to see the actual cost, I have to use my phone’s browser because they don’t show you within the app, but there have been books I want that are only $2-3, which would be a total waste of a credit, so I just buy them with my credit card. The only con for me would be (as of December 2022, at least) is the poor compatibility with iOS, you can’t use Siri for any commands other than rewind/play/pause/forward. Since I listen with my AirPods most of the time, it would be nice, but I guess I understand with the whole Alexa vs. Siri war.

Audible.title: EDIT one of my most used apps.
Audible.body: EDIT: Thanks so much for the response, team. I updated the app and am so relieved. I can’t tell you how much I was missing listening to my books. So happy it was just a bug! Definitely giving the app 5 stars overall! I LOVE my audiobooks. Audible was one of my very top used apps, as I have a hard time focusing on tasks around the house/work/etc without some sort of sensory input. I have it running almost all the time. The last update ruined the whole app for me. I live way out in the middle of nowhere with no wifi and only the most tenuous connection to the data network. Suddenly, after updating the app, it won’t play any of my DOWNLOADED titles without an internet connection. What the heck is the point of taking up my phone storage space downloading all these books, if I now can’t even play them from my phone?? I am so disappointed, as I can’t listen to any of my favorite books at home anymore because I can’t find a place to connect enough to start the chapter. I know I’m just one random human to a huge corporation, but please, please, please, fix this. I am already missing my books acutely. It’s so disappointing to not be able to play my selection of downloaded books.

Apple Music.title: Check download songs
Apple Music.body: Everything is good and I love apple music. The only thing I want is to check the downloaded songs cuz sometimes it couldn’t play the songs when I am offline and it got stuck on the same song. If the carousel mode is still working that looks cool as well.

Apple Music.title: iOS 16.4.1 - Terrible for Apple Music
Apple Music.body: Since iOS 16.4.1 there has been terrible delays in-between skipping songs and playing another song. There seems to be some invisible buffering whether or not it’s connected to the internet, even downloaded songs wont play for 10-20 seconds. When searching an Artist or Album, it won’t open when you click on it 🤷🏼‍♂️ I don’t know what you’ve done to the app but it’s the worst it’s been since it was launched and I’ve been playing for it since the start! PLEASE UPDATE ASAP!!!! It’s horrible and I pay for it and it won’t work properly

Apple Music.title: I do not recommend this service as there are many issues
Apple Music.body: 1) No mechanism to provide feedback and report issues via the app. 2) No way to search for items in your existing playlists in online or offline mode - this is a significant limitation. I don’t recommend subscribing to Apple Music if you have a large collection of music and wish to play specific songs - you will have to scroll through 100s of songs yourself to find the one you want to play. 3) Cannot use Apple Music when connected to an external monitor. When connecting via USB-C to an external monitor on an ipad, the only option is to play the music on the external monitor (no option to play the music via the built-in speakers on the iPad itself). This is not a good decision as the developers are forgetting that many monitors do not have speakers. This renders the Apple Music unusable. Quite an oversight considering that the docking functionality of the iPad is targeted at productivity applications.

Apple Music.title: Prefer the clean experience
Apple Music.body: I’ve dabbled with Apple Music and the competition and always end up coming back. It’s clean and does music how I expect it. The app isn’t overloaded with extra features I don’t want to use and the experience is pretty stable. I like the lyrics and lossless quality. I also enjoy the curated playlists and the radio stations. I don’t think I’ll ever switch again.

Apple Music.title: Apples way - or else
Apple Music.body: The usual Apple mafia-like Apple way of doing business this app is only useful if you subscribe to the music service.  I have a MacBook Air with iTunes playlists that won’t sync to the Music app on my iphone.  Apple are always trying to force or trick you into paying for their services, this comes at a cost of usability even for someone who owns two Apple devices.  The devices don’t connect easily through the iTunes-Music app without a subscription..  Good business for Apple but deeply cynical and disrespectful of its users.

Apple Music.title: The new
Apple Music.body: I don’t know 🤷‍♂️ why but I’m just really happy 😊 I’m happy 😊 happy 😊 thank for the kind words I hope 🤞 it will help a lot more people to get through it and I hope 🤞 to see your tweets too much and I’m glad to hear you have some fun and good times with your family too and I hope you get well too much too soon too soon too soon too I love 💕 🤣

Apple Music.title: Good bit won’t download my songs
Apple Music.body: I have had this app for a long time and it’s really good. When I’m at home with wifi I tap to download the songs in my playlist but it doesn’t download. Today I tired to listen to a song thats not in my playlist and I waited like 10 minutes for it to play and it didn’t play so I went to my playlist and it only played certain songs that were downloaded so I tapped the download button but it didn’t work, it was like what it’s like when I don’t have wifi but maybe that’s just my phone because I have an iPhone 6s.

Apple Music.title: WOW! 5 Stars!
Apple Music.body: Apple  Music is probably my favourite music app ON EARTH! Apple music has a wide variety of songs of different genres. It does need wifi, but if you download your songs, you can listen with absolutely no wifi. You can my playlists and it plays all of the songs in the playlist going from one to the next. Another amazing feature is that you can make songs play over and over again without you clicking it over again. In my opinion, Apple Music is such a great app and I think you would enjoy it too.

Apple Music.title: Sorting according to Alphabetical order
Apple Music.body: It will great to have a alphabetical sort order within your playlist. This way duplicates can be removed if same song has been saved for the same artist. The search function within the same playlist does not show correctly when the artist name is typed. I have Jimmy Ruffin song of 2 versions. When I type Ruffin it shows only 1 of the songs. In Apple TV when I goto the bottom of the playlist and select a song, it starts playing the first song. This has happened very often. Exiting/closing the Application makes no difference. Is there a limit to the number of songs within a playlist. Currently I have more than 800 songs added to a playlist.

Apple Music.title: Decided: never will give Apple 1 more cent
Apple Music.body: Apple won’t allow me to even play my own music. This is extremely stupid. I paid the blood price for this stupid device, knowing they will make it hard to use efficiently. I said to myself “is ok, it might take 10 extra steps to copy my own files into it, but then I can play them” or “it might be extremely hard to get a picture out of the camera, but camera isn’t that bad”. Anyway, now I cannot even play the files. Apple executives might be saving up to see if they can afford to live slightly longer greedy lives, as they fear for the extremely selective and cautive circle of hell that awaits for them. By the way, the battery is doing its best to force me to go back to ANY other phone, by depleting itself like there’s no tomorrow. And I swear for the old gods and new: I will never buy another Apple product.

Apple Music.title: Couple of suggestions.
Apple Music.body: 1. Search function is way too specific. I thought Apple would get this right by now. Literally copy + paste Spotify’s search system: keywords, misspelling and partially correct searches should show ALL returned content and sort by popularity, with popular content at the top.2. Create a “remove from current playlist” function in the hold menu of any song in your queue that is playing from the current playlist. Another simple one that would make all the difference, saves scrolling through a playlist for a song that shows up that shouldn’t be there.3. Content in “My Library” used to show up instantly in search, now there’s a delay like it’s scanning some sort of online database. Not a big issue but just wondering what changed?

Apple Music.title: Can’t even save a radio station?!
Apple Music.body: Can’t save radio stations?  Even my $50 car radio in the 80’s could do that. But a $2550 iPhone with an Apple Music subscription can’t? Welcome to 2024 where you have to search for your radio stations every time. Does anyone else feel like me that your old stereo was more fun & intuitive to use. Finding stuff seems like too much effort to me. In the old days I could pinpoint a cd/dvd/tape etc on my shelf in seconds. This feels like a tech downgrade. Wish I could better put in words but feels like everything is hidden. Maybe we need to bring back skewamorphic design? Not sure but would be good if I could use my eyes more than having to rely on my memory. It’s actually what I hate about most modern tech

Apple Music.title: Not designed as a personal SONG librarian
Apple Music.body: Some people just want a good flexible easy to use software, ability to transfer songs and arrange playlists between their multiple devices, unfortunately this is not a great choice as it does not allow you to load songs or manipulate your playlists on portable devices, it has serious restrictions which makes this software useless or very hard to persevere with.No lyrics display editor on portable devices, no easy and logical way to transfer data between devices i could go on and on.Stage traxx 3 is a much better program to use if you need a very powerfull librarian, replay software with great lyrics display and editing, song chords if you happen to be a musician and loads more features to help you manipulate your music.MUSIC you need a good look at yourself, keep up with real peoples needs and wants.

Apple Music.title: NOT HAPPY!!!
Apple Music.body: Been using Apple Music for years but today I noticed an huge error with playlists in this music App. After updating to the new iOS 15.4.1 (on Sunday); today (Tuesday) I went to play my regular playlist and noticed that HALF of the songs (from the top to the middle) was deleted out of the playlist! I never change the order of the songs and I don’t never like deleting songs out either. About 50 to 100 songs just disappeared out of that playlist but only after updating to the newest iOS. THANKFULLY they are still purchased and in my library still! But it’s going to be extremely frustrating putting every single song back and trying to remember each placing. This error has never happened in the entire 10 years I’ve used the Music App/Apple iPhone. There is also no possible way for anyone to take over my iPhone at any time so I know that it’s not that.Is there anyway I get the data back from the a few weeks ago? I do not use iCloud and I synced/updated my data to another device before noticed that the iOS removed half the playlist. P.s: I noticed that skipping through the songs now is INCREDIBLY laggy! It takes more than 2 seconds to skip through. Even through just 2 songs and back.

Apple Music.title: Sound Quality
Apple Music.body: I have an iPhone 11 Pro Max, still in perfect condition no issues with it at all, Best Phone I have ever had since the iPhone 6Plus! Recently towards mid November 2023 I updated my phone to the most recent IOS as you do with Apple products. I had only recently as well subscribed to My Music making it the first time I’ve paid for songs on my phone no issues. Sound was great Bluetooth in the car music is great loud bass everything perfect as you would expect for paying for this service. However, after upgrading to the latest IOS streaming music now in my car has been horrible the sound quality is low, no bass no more have to put my car volume to full to even hear the words of any song now. Initially I thought maybe my Bluetooth was playing up, nope. Turned my phone off and restart re-downloaded music app nope still same issue. I then stream music from another free app and it was playing like how My Music use to play. Apple please fix this, I don’t want to cancel I love that every song is available I just the quality to return please I don’t even know what happened please fix

Apple Music.title: Great, a suggestion
Apple Music.body: I love Apple Music, have been using it for years as my main music streaming service. Super clean and easy-to-use interface, simple format to make playlists and discover artists etc, I love it. Definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a new service. A suggestion I have is to be able to see how many times you have listened to a song. I know on the laptop/pc version this is available, but since I mainly use Apple Music on mobile this would be super convenient. Especially as the music usage doesn’t always sync, making the statistics less accurate for the non mobile devices. Perhaps this could be integrated into the sort function or in the drop down menu that shows up when you press and hold on a song. Either way, I would love to see this feature added.

Apple Music.title: Sing option
Apple Music.body: Beautiful app with great exclusive features, however, I noticed the song feature was stripped from my device (IPhone XS Max), before the software update and application update I had this feature. Now I notice on the Apple website that it is only supported from IPhone 11+. A bit disappointed this feature was removed from my mobile device and was curious on why it was, however, does not change the main opinion of the application. Great interface and the exclusive audios and features within songs that are only available on Apple Music and not on other streaming platforms make the experience of switching enjoyable and immersive with the content.

Apple Music.title: Not happy.
Apple Music.body: As a user of iTunes since 2005 (previous products much longer) and having around a 100gb of Music, I feel qualified to give fair critique, I think it’s disgusting that albums paid for in full seem to have a shelf life (depending on I’m guessing licensing agreements) Apple fails to notify of these changes and when attempting to listen to these albums sometimes at a much later date, it now says not available in your country or region, it was available when you sold it to me though and I downloaded but now isn’t available and the downloaded also disappear, I see this as theft, and considering Apple now has us locked in, I mean obviously once you have built a substantial music library (and movies etc) leaving for a different or maybe better product becomes unrealistic because of the costs of replacing your whole library, not just the device,  I’m tired of these silent but real standover tactics of Apple (and other corporations). The truth is it’s really bad service because we older and long term customers are the founding customers who built your business, the fact you don’t recognise that and pretty well treat us how you please is disgraceful.

Apple Music.title: Spam pop up Ads - Is this really run by Apple
Apple Music.body: Apple Music ads are now running as spam pop-ups that take you to the subscribe page when you click to close the spam ads in all kinds of games that normally have the dodgiest of ads - like Zynga’s Words With Friends.Many of Zynga’s games have been proven to be types of gambling in disguise, where the players can not win real-world fiat currency (money), but can easily lose hundreds of dollars a week by being baited by their apps to buy all kinds of worthless digital products in order to win the live online anonymous player games.They abuse psychology, including child psychology with games available to young children to fill their coffers with every increasing billions in profits from vulnerable people and the young and innocent alike.Is Apple’s senior management aware that the likes of Apple Music’s marketing team are in cahoots with such low lives?

Apple Music.title: Baffling app design
Apple Music.body: This app is very poor, especially compared to Tidal. When I first started with Tidal, it’s library was modest, but now it is Apple that is lagging, at least with artists that I like. The Apple Music app is not intuitive. It is hard to find music- it’s easier to find music in the ‘Sleep’ genre than Jazz! I gather that their song/artist recommendations are poor too (in Tidal they’re excellent). Your ability to customise your home screen is non existent. For example, why do I have to see ‘kids corner’? For someone who doesn’t have kids (or who wants to but cannot) this is annoying/depressing. The creators of the Apple Music app seem obsessed with playlists. It’s easier find out what other people are listening to (top charts, curated playlists etc) than to find things that I like or might be interested in! It is bizarre!Speaking of bizarre, my library has artists and albums from iTunes days, and newly favourited albums. But newly-favourites artists? Oh no, sorry they’re under the ‘listen now’ section. So despite innovations like the expansion of Lossless and the addition of Spatial Audio, it’s still junk. It’s like selling some of the best ice cream in the world from a recently used abattoir that has a dubious hygiene record. Hope this helps others’ decisions.

Apple Music.title: Download issue
Apple Music.body: After the new 15.02 update its hard to download songs on full resolution. Sometimes the songs stop playing after 15 seconds and its tough to download songs. Also, it glitches and stops playing songs if it is not downloaded

Apple Music.title: Switching back to Spotify
Apple Music.body: Lagged on my computer, poor suggestion of songs, literally my taste in music dropped after switching from Spotify to Apple Music.

It took me multiple hours of the course of a few days too add and download over 900 songs, after about a week or two of using the app almost all my music DISAPPEARED. I woke up one day and had only 126 songs left on my account out of over 900… 800 songs just disappeared, I’m extremely disappointed and frustrated. Downloading Spotify instead!! If I could give this review 0/5 stars I WOULD

Apple Music.title: New IOS update trash
Apple Music.body: No way to review the update so here ya go apple… why you get rid of the old wallpaper and have such a limited selection now??? You supposed to get better, not the complete opposite… very disappointed with apple and all it’s product and service(s)… especially Apple Music, the radio is Better at saving my music than apple is… two thumbs down apple 👎👎
