Steam.title: Steam is going downhill
Steam.body: Steam has for many years been useful for three reasons: keeping your library in one place, downloading and installing your games, and sales. Client changes in 2019 through 2020 have rendered the library more difficult and frustrating to use than just browsing with Windows Explorer.Download speeds have gotten progressively worse, month by month, since around the beginning of 2019.  At this point, downloading a game requires first spending hours repeatedly trying combinations of server and VPN location just to hit 1Mbps.  Sales are still regular and good, but what use is that if we can't browse the games we've bought to launch and manage them, and can't download them without sacrificing all our free time for each one?  Many people are blaming Valve's flat management structure for this, but who knows whether that's the ultimate underlying cause?  Maybe they've tried some new things that haven't worked.  But whatever it is, they could just restore the client and download servers to the January 2019 version and it would be the best update of the last two years. At this point, I honestly wish I could transfer all my software licenses to a different service.  I'd leave Steam altogether, were it not for thousands of dollars in games held hostage.

But instead of being treated in good faith, I was denied a refund for using the simulator for more than a very small 2 hours (which by the way I used trying to throttle the performance settings of the simulator to make it playable, all with no luck). I even wrote them a second time saying they were being inconsistent by not refunding my for X-Plane though they had refunded me for Microsoft Flight Simulator, which I had "played" for 18 hours according to Steam. I hadn't--those 18 hours were used just trying to download the files! Why refund me for 18 hours, but not 2? I don't like being taken advantage of. Especially considering it costs them absolutely nothing to refund a game purchase since they're entirely digital and there is no added inventory or logistics cost. Their lack of ethics also strikes a nerve because all I wanted with the simulator was to use something healthy to cope with my weakened mental health/increased anxiety due to COVID, and this is how I'm treated. Ubisoft.title: A Non Collector's Edition

The book is not available for purchase anywhere else so it isnt like I can just buy the book elsewhere and enjoy the rest of it. In terms of collectability value, the damage therefore renders the Collectors Edition that I paid £200 for utterly worthless. As Ubisoft designed and developed the Collectors Edition we got in touch with them, not only explaining the problem but also providing pictures and proof of purchase. Our hope was that they might be able to send us a replacement book as we know that other game companies have done this for their gamers in similar circumstances. Unfortunately, Ubisoft is a company that doesn't give a damn about its gamers. They told us that we need to take it up with Game. This was damaged when it was made guys, have you not heard of quality control?! That was last night and  we are still waiting for an acknowledgment from Game. I can't tell you how disappointed I am. I ordered this 6 months ago and have looked forward to it for 6 months. It was a lot of money and like I might as well have set fire to my £200. I'm very angry and will not be buying anything else from Ubisoft, be it games, collectors editions or any other merchandise. If I don't get a resolution from Game, I'll be reporting both companies to trading standards. I never let a company rip me off more than once.

Ubisoft.title: Get ready to wait...
Ubisoft.body: My most recent experience with Ubisoft Customer Support has solidified them in my mind as having some of the worst customer support currently.  I understand they are probably grossly understaffed and being that customer support/technical support are not revenue generating, they're usually seen as nothing more than a bill to company stakeholders and thus are given paltry budgets, are severely overworked and understaffed.With that said, we as customers should not be given this kind of experience when we contact a company for assistance, especially when we are their customer.  These last 60 days of dealing with Ubisoft support has really made me question if I want to purchase any more of their products.  Ubisoft have definitely been on an upswing these last few years so they should have customer and technical support in place to match this.Long story longer; I had an issue where my bank was double charged $49.99 USD or so I thought as when I was making a purchase I got a pop up that said my bank was NOT charged due to an error.  Well evidently it was charged even though I received no receipt or e-mail about this charge. It took Ubisoft support ONE MONTH to come to the conclusion that yes, the charge was indeed correct, I received the items I purchased.  One month!  I did not dispute or argue with them about it.  If they said that I received the items and it was just a glitch in theirs or Xsolla's system then so be it.However, I've been asking for the receipts for this rogue purchase now for almost a month following this.  Ubisoft continue to shut my ticket and I'm having to reopen.  They send me the most canned responses imaginable and close the ticket even after saying MULTIPLE times that I am not disputing the charge any longer and I'm not asking for a refund!  I just want the receipt for this charge which they said is accurate!  If this is indeed an accurate charge, why can Ubisoft not provide me with a receipt for it?  Why is this ongoing for almost 2 months now?  Why did Ubisoft originally tell me when I opened the ticket 2 months ago that someone would be with me (and I quote here) "very quickly"  yet my ticket remained absolutely SILENT from Ubisoft for almost one month?  I only got a response when I wrote in that I was about to go to my bank and flag the charge as fraudulent. THAT is when I finally got a response...and it was just the generic "we're working on your issue" style reply.One month folks...for a response...after asking then once of twice a week for updates...and only after threatening to go to my bank did they even bother to reply.  That is "very quickly" by Ubisoft Support's standards!I highly recommend that you think twice prior to purchasing their products or any of their virtual goods.  And if you have to contact their support...be warned that you're going to get canned responses for at least the first week or two if you get ANY response at all from them.Terrible, terrible, unacceptable customer service.

Ubisoft.title: Literal thieves (and lazy ones as well).
Ubisoft.body: The epitome of pure evil.Imagine buying a car one day. At first you don't think much of it other than a tool to get you to work and back home. But over the years, you grow to love it. It begins to have a lot of sentimental value to you, even though objectively speaking it depreciates over time.Then, one day 10 years later, the dealership breaks into your house and steals it back, because over the years it discarded the records to your purchase agreement and has no way to actually verify that the purchase ever occurred. But, instead of acting with, you know, COMMON SENSE because it's been 10 YEARS, the dealership decides it can't be bothered. So instead of just dropping the issue (like any semi-reasonable adult with half a brain would), it instead goes the kleptomaniac, paranoid route, like a 21st century rendition of penny-pinching Ebenezer Scrooge with an unhealthy penchant for snorting crack.This analogy is logically identical to what Ubisoft is now doing by disabling DLC access to their older games, many of which are LITERALLY 10 YEARS OLD, because it can't move past its dinosaur policy of retaining DRM, despite there being plenty of objective statistical evidence demonstrating that DRM does little to nothing to combat piracy.Screw Ubisoft.

Ubisoft.title: A fine example of "Industry standard"
Ubisoft.body: This company is a fine example of an "industry standard". They used to be a market leader, creating truly unique games at the time. Now they are mostly uninspired games, with amazing ideas (clearly driven by passionate devs) and corporate execution. I think the fact this company is so massive holds back the few talented people that they have working for them.Most of their games feel identical after about 10 hours of playtime. I don't know how I would approach the problem of making a shooter and wintersports games appear similar, but they slapped their infamous open world format on both and BOOM! They are about 85% identical.Every game that launched in past decade or so launched with critical bugs. Some of them didn't even get fixed to date. For instance: Ubisoft games (or maybe the launcher) are infamous for freezing PC after you the game. At this point it's a 4 year old problem that gets its own FAQ page with a generic "reinstall everything" solution. Finally, every game shoves microtransactions into my face.  Shop is in every UI of past few games I've played. I bought an "Ultimate" edition of the game and it still tries to milk me for more. Can you keep your ads to yourself and 20-40$ "micro"-transactions in your launcher please?As I said, a fine example of "Industry standard".

Ubisoft.title: Worst experience ever
Ubisoft.body: No other gaming company has caused me this much frustration and anger. I downloaded a gaming demo off of Steam the other day and boy am I glad that I didn't pay a cent for it because I couldn't even access the damn demo because of the terrible way that everything was set up. Before I can even play the game, I have to make a uplay account, which is fine, except for the fact that every time I tried to make the account, I was given an error message that account creations are unavailable at this time. I decided to wait about a day to see if there were any improvements on this front--there weren't, it was the exact same error message. I then decided to look online to see if anybody had any way to fix this; apparently, in order for me to make the account I had to go to the website istelf. Why even offer a service on the application if it doesn't work at all and you have to go somewhere else to get it done?Whatever, I thought this was the end of my troubles; it wasn't. No of course not, that would be too easy and would require for this company to actually try to make something functional. Because of course, now the issue is that it's having trouble connecting, despite the fact that my internet connection is just fine. I reload and try the same thing only for the same problem to arise, so at this point I just decide to try and play offline. Guess again, apparently I need to log in at least once to be able to play offline and apparently in order for me to able to log in at least once, I need to play online, which I can't do. Wonderful. So once again, I have to rely on the internet to tell me what to do, and none of the suggestions worked. I checked my internet settings, I turned off my ad blocker, I checked proxy settings to make sure nothing was blocking the game's connection, I relaunched the game, I reset my computer, etc. Nothing worked. I saw someone say that they needed to download a vpn in order to be able to fix their issue. That's ridiculous. Why should I need to download a vpn in order to fix a problem that shouldn't be a problem to begin with? This is where I gave up and uninistalled the demo.Steam says that I played the demo for 15 minutes and not a single one of those 15 minutes were spent on the actual game itself.This is an absolute embarrasment on the company and it is astounding how they let problems like these remain.

Ubisoft.title: Might as well be EA.
Ubisoft.body: I have been a Ubisoft Customer for many years, since the original Rayman on the PS1 and then Assassin's Creed on the Xbox 360. I am a massive fan of the Trials games and have bought them all over the years. However after dealing with Ubisoft Connect, I will now go out of my way to avoid buying anything from Ubisoft ever again. Ubisoft connect is complete garbage and it makes playing Ubisoft games orders of magnitude more difficult to deal with. From the app not connecting, or crashing, or wanting to always be online, or asking for the password over and over and over, to signing me out not more than 15 minutes since I last signed in (and ticked "remember me"), I've just had enough. Curse you Ubisoft and all of your greedy/incompetent executives making the decisions at the top. Alongside the microtransactions that are basically turning Ubisoft into EA Games, the latest Trials game and Riders Republic are both massive hot messes and clearly hasn't been planned properly or tested from a UI point of view, and that's even if I can play them due to Ubi connect garbage getting in the way. Games don't need a launcher nowadays, and Ubisoft's insistence to integrate everything more and more heavily in the terrible launchers has driven away a customer entirely. Well done Ubisoft, you probably wasted a great deal of money and teams of people to create Connect, and all it's done has ensured that a long time customer has grown to hate your organisation and I will be doing my absolute best to avoid playing anything you make in the future. The fact that I'm so angry with your company that I have to write a review here, simply makes me even more angry.I hope you're happy, because I sure as hell am not, and I'm going to vote with my wallet. By the looks of the other reviews on here, I am not alone in my opinions. Well done, your corpoate leadership are cretins who are out of touch with their customers. Sack them all and replace them with an old mouldy potato hooked up to a random decision generator. It wouldn't make things any worse the way I see it.

Ubisoft.body: UPDATE: After 34 days (which seems to be the kind of timescale their support staff work to), they let me know that I am "blocked from performing any transactions on the Uplay store... due to the fact that there was a chargeback in a previous transaction". Which would be the time Paypal stepped in to protect my rights on the previous issue, below. You stay classy, Ubisoft.=================I had a terrible experience with Ubisoft support a couple of years ago, and now I'm having another, so I thought it's time to review.In summary, Ubisoft support can take a ridiculous amount of time (we're talking weeks) to respond, and are currently 0 for 2 on actually resolving a request.Current issue: Yesterday I tried to buy 5 games in their sale, but it kept saying the payment failed. I first tried with PayPal, and it didn't even take me to a PayPal login or anything like that, just went straight to failed. I then tried my credit and debit cards (whoops!). It was only today when I decided to try again that I found a forum thread from a month ago, of people complaining about the same thing, and that they'd been charged! So I checked my accounts, and yep there are the payments, in pending transactions. I've updated my support tickets and am not expecting a timely response (see previous issue), so no doubt will have to call my bank to dispute the payments. Yay.Previous issue: I bought a collector's edition of AC Syndicate (on sale, I'm not that stupid), which included a large figurine, and that arrived broken. Here's the timeline of my support case: 2016-12-02: I opened a support ticket, including asking whether I could open the game and use it, or would need to return the whole package. 2016-12-14: Ubi replied asking for photos, which I supplied within half an hour2016-12-19: Ubi closed the case. I added a message to reopen2016-12-20: Ubi apologised for a "glitch" when escalating, and confirmed that I could not open and use the game (thanks guys!)2017-01-20: I messaged to chase, and inform them I'd be opening a PayPal dispute on 2nd Feb.2017-02-10: Ubi told me "In order to request a replacement for your, I would like to ask you to close the dispute." Of course, I refused, because why would I trust them.2017-02-22: Ubi messaged again to tell me to close the dispute. I ignored them and escalated the PayPal dispute to a claim.2017-03-06: PayPal offered me almost half my money back, which seemed fair, given the value of the game vs the collector's tat. Part of me regrets not demanding a full refund, just to punish Ubisoft for being so dreadful and wasting so much of my time.As this is a review of the Ubi Store, and not Ubisoft's predatory business practices, I won't even get into the fact that I only bought a collector's edition because I wanted all the DLC / in-game content.

Ubisoft.title: 2 Months and counting for a refund! Worst customer support
Ubisoft.body: I preordered assassins creed odyssey in June. I did not receive it on launch day early October so i wanted to return it.First of all the delivery company they choose is a joke. They had a delay, so I received the game 3 days later. The delivery company apparently also had a nice employee who unboxed the game so it fitted through the mailbox. I wanted to return it so i thought if i do not accept it it will be returned, which would be faster.This was now not possible, since the package was forcefully delivered through my mailbox, so i notified in the support ticket what happened and they said that was unacceptable and they would send a shipment label if i took pictures of the condition of the package. What a courage! Even though I said what the delivery guy did they wanted proof of the condition of the package. Thankfully the package itself was still in wrapping so it was still acceptable for return.After he verified the condition it took them two to three weeks to send the shipment label. Yes almost a MONTH! Their return policy is that a package can be returned within 14 days of receival, well they will take month to make you even able to return it.Like that was not enough it is now December, 2 months after I wanted to return the game, 1 month after the package has been returned to them and they received it (it had tracking so i know they received it). I do not get any replies on the support ticket. The last I heard was that it was put through to the shop team for a refund. This was on October 23th.Since that day I tried to call them multiple times but i never spoke to one person. It puts you in a selection menu and after that it keeps you in a lobby and says no one is available and to please wait.  I tried to reach out to their twitter support page, but the only answer i get there is they have a huge backlog to work through, but on any followup question they do not reply anymore.To this day I still have to receive a refund. This is really stupid for such a big company. I have nothing against their games, I really like them, but this was the first time i purchased a game through their own online shop instead of a local store near me and it is the last time.

Ubisoft.title: Good games, Insulting Business Model, Awful support, Crappy UPLAY platform
Ubisoft.body: Hello,I really appreciate the games they are releasing. There are definitely a lot of talented people involved in the creation process. But, once a game is released, the nightmare for the customers begins. I think the problems began when they somehow concluded that piracy is affecting their business. So they started coming up with their own ridiculous DRM schemes to protect their games against everyone, even their loyal customers. And then they started releasing multiple versions of the same title, with various bonuses, making sure that nobody can get the entire game content. You bought the standard version of a game and want to upgrade to Deluxe, Well, guess what, you need to also buy the Deluxe version. Don't get me started on Assassin's Creed III that was completely butchered. They improved their approach with newer titles, so there's a glimmer of hope, but they didn't bother to fix the older titles. Some of the titles are poorly integrated with the UPLAY platform (like older Assasssin's Creed titles, Heroes Of Might And Magic VI, Splinter Cell Conviction..), mainly titles with DLCs that are incompatible with UPLAY and need to be activated in-game. To make matters worse, some DLCs come with separate installers, which have a 5 download limit and are also set to expire. In some cases, there's no indication (in-game or anywhere else) of what content is actually available. And on top of that, there are DLCs that don't activate properly or simply don't work at all, as the content is missing in-game.Contacting support is a nightmare, They have a very difficult time understanding the problems and come up with some of the ridiculous solutions. With a few exceptions, I felt like I was talking with aliens.

Ubisoft.title: Worst Customer Service
Ubisoft.body: I am so saddened by the experience I have had with Ubisoft. I never usually preorder games because they're usually out of my budget, i tend to either rent or wait for a massive drop in price. After having one of the most unique fun experiences with South Park: Stick of Truth I immediately pre-ordered the gold edition when it was shown at E3. Now a lot of people who ordered this from the PS store were immediately given access to a PS4 digital copy of Stick of Truth, but I'd have to wait as I ordered from the Ubisoft store. So that was a bit of a downer. A year or so passes and I've been really looking forward to when this game comes out, Then in June I was got a new job in Scotland, not long after getting this news I changed my address on the Ubisoft website. Deleted whatever trace of my old address was. Then - Saturday 12th August I got an email saying it has been dispatched to my old address. I called every DHL company I could get hold of, they were all unable to help as the dutch one doesn't communicate with the UK one etc. At the beginning of this I opened a opened a case on the Ubisoft Support site. I managed to track my delivery which was still clearly going to my old address but on the day it said there was a problem delivering, 'issue with the address' - reading this I thought it could be Ubisoft having eventually contacted DHL. But no.. It went out for delivery the next day and apparently someone signed for it. No doubt they didn't actually ask the name of the person, and just gave whoever one of those crap touch screens where all you do it squiggle a line.I didn't hear anything from them until the 19th August. At which point they just said. 'OK got your message we will escalate it'The next message I received was on the 3rd November. 'The request to change the address was made after deadline so this address was never changed from our side, making the only solution now being trying to retrieve the parcel from the old address.'I put money on it they don't know when I changed my address because I KNOW that I changed my address in plenty of time. They're just rubbing their hands of me and telling me to shove it up my... I'm absolutely gutted by this experience. I cannot believe how they have treated me after having prebacked a project of theirs and putting trust into the product. They've now just swallowed my £70 and told me to F off. What a SMALL gesture it would have been for them to offer a digital version, a code for gods sake, would be absolutely NO skin of their nose.

Electronic Arts (EA).title: Unethical & Untrustworthy
Electronic Arts (EA).body: Recently, I purchased the Horse Ranch expansion pack for The Sims 4 game.  I was double-billed and voiced my concern about this through PayPal as this was the payment platform used.  I also addressed EA about it.  EA never responded so I brought the concern through PayPal as a dispute.  PayPal gave EA a certain amount of time to respond but they never responded at all.  PayPal gave back one of my payments, as requested.However, even though there was still another payment that went through and EA has it (I also have proof of the purchase), they not only ripped the Horse Ranch expansion from my Sims 4 library but have put a ban/suspension on my account without explanation.  I've been spending the past few days trying to resolve the problem but all they do is either ignore me or send me in circles.  Nothing has moved forward at all.Because of the ban/suspension, I can't even play The Sims 4 at all.  The customer service has so far sucked as it seems there is none.  There is zero sign of ethics from a company that I've been loyal to since the original Sims was released.  This is how they thank my long-time patronage.  I'm not impressed with EA at all.Right now, the EA I see is unethical and untrustworthy as they not only robbed me with a double charge for an expansion back but robbed me of everything I paid for as a game.  Between Sims 3 and Sims 4, I've forked out close to $1000 with them and if they're unwilling to restore my account then I should have every dime I spent on them refunded back to me.  I didn't violate any agreements when I voiced my legitimate concern.  I wasn't rude but I was concerned.  I'm the one that's been violated here - more than once - by a company that once upon a time had ethics.I'm adding to this - now EA thinks I don't own The Sims 4 at all, which isn't true.  I bought it in 2014, along with most of the expansion packs, game packs, and stuff packs.  I did figure out PayPal screwed up with the Horse Ranch Expansion pack so that's on them.  However, when EA reps can't get their own facts straight by telling me a game I've owned for 9 years I never paid for, we have an issue.  I'm not getting customer service here.  I'm getting customer disservice.

Electronic Arts (EA).title: -10 Origin updates completely ruined my game
Electronic Arts (EA).body: -10. Why isn't it possible to do minus stars? Minus 10 stars for all Sims 4 Origin game software and updates: being forced to do everything only online through Origin, including updates.I will try and add this review to every Sim 4 pack I own in order to try and warn people of this problem because it affects every single pack I have bought – and, unless they actually fix it, sadly wasted my money on.As I sometimes prefer old fashioned things, I’ve always been a bit dubious about having to download and play the Sims 4 game solely via Origin and always having to be online to start the game, I think, as I much prefer to have something tangible such as DVDs etc. Unfortunately the latest Origin update has proved me to be right as their latest update has completely and utterly ruined 95% of my game! I had naively assumed that updates could only be a good thing in order to protect my computer and improve game performance. Well, that was completely wrong. 95% of my characters are covered in weird, random tattoos from head to toe and look like aliens – which might be considered fun, but only if I chose that - which I most definitely have not.I reported the problem as a bug on 8th December 2020 after the update on 7th. I used the chat to ask for advice on 10th December, but all they could say was to wait for the next update, whenever that might be as, apparently, they are working to fix the problem their update created. When I checked my case today, 14th, all it says is “NO FIX AVAILABLE” with nothing to indicate that they are actually bothering to try and fix it or not and I can’t be bothered to waste yet more time trying to find out today.I could not be a more dissatisfied customer than I am right now. The actual game is usually great, although Sims 2 Apartment Life was far superior, in my opinion, to Sims 4 City Living, as was Sims 2 Bon Voyage compared to Sims 4 Island Living in some ways. But unfortunately it doesn’t seem like it will be possible to install my old fashioned Sims 2 discs and completely avoid Origin and their download rubbish, as I would like to do, as it refuses to install so far.Unless they actually fix this problem I am definitely not going to waste any more money on Origin, and after this awful gaming experience probably won’t anyway. Thankfully I’ve always waited for 50% discounts before buying extras, so at least I didn’t waste more money than I already have. Just as well it’s only a game and not anything actually important!I had to uninstall and reinstall everything – all because Origin controls everything and is useless at fixing any problems they cause with their updates. They presumably don’t care less about their customers once they have their money. So I’m not going to bother wasting any more of my money on their products because their so-called ‘customer service’ is so useless and a complete waste of time.

Electronic Arts (EA).title: Sims 4 Wedding Stories Click Bait
Electronic Arts (EA).body: I purchased Sims 4 Wedding Stories game pack on February 23, 2022 the day it was released and I am actively seeking a refund at the time of this review. It is a game pack that is supposed to add new gameplay features for $19.99. The Gameplay features were inactive. By inactive I mean, you press the button and nothing happens. Which clearly isn't the intention. I contacted EA and eventually they sent me useless instructions to restart my computer and eventually stated there was no fix. March 5, Sims team released a public message saying they were investigating the issues but had no ETA on a fix just said in the coming weeks. It's been 3 weeks and they are still "investigating" I filed another case this time requesting a refund since clearly they don't know how to fix it and the game is virtually unplayable in this state. I purchased the pack for the advertised gameplay functions that do not work.There is some community debate on how broken the pack was before it was released and how much the Sims 4 development knew (there was early access game play by simmers that regularly promote the Sims and guess what? It was broken then and they talked about releasing a patch then BEFORE its February 23 release. So they knew. The fact that you cannot perform the advertised gameplay functions should entitle a customer to a refund. Instead I was passed over to multiple agents all of whom promised to "assist me with my issue" and then not assist me with my issue. I was asked for my order number to assist with a refund then never received a follow up email so I logged into my EA account and saw EA marked my case as a duplicate (Even though this is the first time I'm requesting a refund) and I had to follow up with a continuation of that case status because I was very confused as I was told they were looking at my order.Next thing I know I receive an email offering to assist me and that they are sorry they couldn't initiate a refund. No explanation, nothing. They knew it wasn't working and didn't have a fix by their own admission and wouldn't issue a refund because it's not within their policy to offer refunds. What? You sold me an unfinished/broken game. What's more disturbing is that EA continued to market the game promoting the new pack and gameplay features after making the public statement on their webpage that they were investigating why the gameplay features were not working as advertised.There was no disclaimer to new simmers or customers that the pack was pretty much a work in progress. And if you don't follow the Sims online, you'll be in the dark as EA help is not very helpful. They string you along for days, "looking into your issue" only to tell you, refunds aren't within their policies.  This is just bad business and even worse customer service. It's unfortunate that they think they can promise you one thing, not provide it and then go on about their way and keep your money while they figure out why it's not working. There is no way this pack should have passed quality assurance when the gameplay features don't work. The trailer was complete clickbait and I feel scammed and cheated. They released it unfinished, ignored community complaints for an entire week before making a statement but were very careful not to claim responsibility for the game not working and treated the whole thing like they were just minor bugs. As of 3/16 there is no ETA on when or if this pack will ever perform as advertised.

Electronic Arts (EA).title: Horrendous Company!
Electronic Arts (EA).body: Purchased Sims 4 then discovered my daughter's laptop wouldn't allow us to download it (laptop runs on Windows 10s) it's brand new, she's only had it a week and we weren't aware that the only content downloadable has to be via the Microsoft store. We thought we could bypass this by purchasing it on my laptop and downloading it onto my daughter's external hard drive and playing it on her laptop via the hard drive... we're not tech savvy and my daughter's laptop wasn't having a bar of this. So, we admitted defeat and within an hour or so of purchasing said game I contactes EA Games, via live web chat, to explain and get the money refunded. Now, in accordance with UK law on distance selling and digital content cooling off periods etc etc I knew I was well within my rights to receive a refund. The purchase was made on Sunday April 19th and by the 28th I'm still awaiting the refund. I contacted the company again, which is no mean feat in itself, only to get a load of flannel, saying there was an issue and it had been referred to a specialist team. I pointed out my legal right to the refund and was told yes, that wasn't the problem it was a technical issue, but not to worry they're sorting it out. I left it at that, taking their advisor at face value. Then a few days later (still zero contact from EA) spotted on my case on their website that it was registering as 'Resolved' but still no sign of the refund on my PayPal account. So, yet again I make contact with them via their web chat. That's when I finally lost patience with them. I asked where my refund was, and said that the length of time I'd waited, with zero contact from them, wasn't acceptable. I was met with it was my fault...my original payment method wasn't working for them to refund to, this migrated to it being PayPal's fault to their advisor finally, squarely, blaming their specialist team. The advisor then terminated the chat before I got the chance to respond. I raised a dispute with PayPal, explained the issue and that EA Games were blaming them. They too contacted EA Games and, from what I gather, also got no response...PayPal have found in my favour and the refund has been granted. It's at this juncture that I decided, out of a morbid curiosity, to look online for any reviews on EA Games, I stumbled across this. I didn't realise it was possible to be shocked and yet not shocked all at the same time...but I managed it! I for one, will never, ever deal with this shoddy company ever again. I made the error of assuming a reasonably big, well known brand wouldn't be so bad..how wrong was I? I usually research companies before I deal with them, I let this one slip past my guard, won't make that mistake again!

Electronic Arts (EA).title: Why Are They Still in Business?
Electronic Arts (EA).body: I think I'm one of the lucky one since I had to deal with EA only two times. But those times where utterly awful!1) My first problem with EA came when I've started to play Star Wars: The Old Republic. After trying the game (back in the day, I think it was 4-5 years ago, you could play for free, until level 20, with Subscriber Privilege) I've decided to pay the subscription for two months and continue playing. The first month everything was fine, but at the start of the second I couldn't log in anymore on my account and I couldn't even get in touch with the Assistance (since I couldn't log in even on the website). I've tried the generic "EA: Contact Us" and nobody answered me on the chat (I couldn't call them since it would have costed me a lot of Euros, and I've waited for almost three hours for nothing). So, for the subscription price I've played only half the time and lost my account completely in less than 30 days.2) More recently I've find out The Sims 4 and I've really liked it. So, I've decided to buy it on Origins (since there was the 20th anniversary discount) with all the expansions (paying A LOT of money) and: first of all there was no Shopping Cart icon on Origin, and I had to buy every installment INDIVIDUALLY (and there's a lot of them). But the worst part was that when I was buying some expansion stuff, Origin started to reject my payment. I've checked that I had money in the credit card (which i had) and I've also tried my girlfriend credit card (and they rejected her after only TWO transictions).My credit card was blocked by my bank because it resulted to them that I've tried THIRTY times to buy something without success (and I swear I've tried only 6 times as my "Current History" on Origin says). Also, we still have no idea why they rejected my girlfriend card as well. I know what you might think: "If the bank blocked your credit card it's not EA fault". And, in part, you are correct. But here's the problems:1) Why my bank received thirty attemps to buy something when I've tried only six times? I don't think that my bank wants to block my credit card pretending something that didn't happend. The only possilbe reason that I thought is that Origin might have some kind of "Try Again the Transiction" (like some phone company when you need to renew your bill contract. They keep sending you a text messages saying that they couldn't renew the contract because there wasn't enough money on the phone). Anyway, it might be also my bank who messed up.2) This is completely EA mess up though. After these two incidents with the credit cards, I've tried to contact the EA Assistance once again and it was like talking to a brick wall. First of all I've posted my problem on their forum and this guy nicknamed "Drako" sayed that I should have call or chat with them. The calling was not an option since I had to pay God knows how since I'm in Italy and it says clearly on the website that calling from the mobile it gonna cost (and sometimes the phone company doesn't even allow you to make that call). So I've decided to go for the chat and, even though it says "Estimated time 11 minutes", I've waited for two hours without any response.I've decided to put another post on the forum and, again, this Drako guy sayed that I should call them or chat with them. After explaining that I couldn't get in touch with them, he KEPT SAYING THAT I SHOULD CALL THEM OR START A CHAT! Seriously, it was like talking to a Bot or something. I even tried to explain the credit card problem and he just said "I tried to buy something on Origin and got no problems... Have you tried to call or start a chat?" O_OI've also told him that I've waited two hours for the chat to open (in the late morning) and that I've tried again for half an hour in the evening, and he just said "During busy periods it can take a little longer than normal for a chat to be initiated"... LITTLE LONGER?!? I really hope that after this I will never had to deal with EA!

The next day I got a response from PayPal stating that the claim was in my favor. i found out today they closed the claim in my favor because EA GAMES NEVER RESPONDED!! Little did I know that PayPal had a policy that automatically reimburses payment when the party in question doesn't respond after x amount of days!! I did not ask for my bank to reimburse me for 9.98 . The original claim was opened only to make sure that I was not being double charged. It is not my fault that a charge back happened. It is EA GAMES fault for not answering to the PayPal claim that was created only to make sure I did not get DOUBLE CHARGES! Now I found out there is no number or way to contact ANYONE who can take this lousy bogus suspension off of my account! I am beyond furious, so much so that I sent an email to the owner and CEO of EA GAMES. If EA GAMES wonders why I am so upset it is because I am a real human being and have invested tons of money that is now being suspended from usage without proper evaluation, without a LIVE care team member to TALK LIVE WITH! Pay pal has tried to help by contacting EA GAMES but the service number provided is not in service! All I was told by pay pal was that indeed I'd have to wait probably 14 days from a response from EA GAMES! I can see from the comments here that this company needs to be forced to make changes to their  criminal like customer service  practices and bogus policies. I couldn't find anywhere in the Rules about Charge back policy. Where in the description of rules does it say ANYTHING about chargeback!? Are these people crooked enough to assume I tried to get a freebie? What freebie, the add-ons were taken off so where is the issue EA GAMES??? I didn't okay a chargeback!
